ygData.subject: Re: PvP BIND AFFINITY y/n??
ygData.msgSnippet: You cannot be bound unless you are in a group with the binder. *shrugs* Just a FYI. Drev
ygData.messageBody:
You cannot be bound unless you are in a group with the binder.

*shrugs*

Just a FYI.

Drev

> ----------
> From: Mata[SMTP:mata_eq@...]
> Reply To: eq_wizards@onelist.com
> Sent: Thursday, April 22, 1999 10:34 AM
> To: eq_wizards@onelist.com
> Subject: [eq_wizards] PvP BIND AFFINITY y/n??
>
> From: "Mata" <mata_eq@...>
>
> I wish UO had not poisoned my mind so much against PvP, but it was just
> heinous. Most UO PKers didn't even kill you in character, it was like "HE
> *&*$^&$ YOU ARE DEAD F*&%ER YOU SUCK blah blah blah"
>
> And what if someone (not you Iggie) was just being a jerk and decided to
> bind you somewhere that you didn't want bound???
> For now I am happy w/ the way they have it, and I think the PvP server and
> arena etc. . . are proof that they are not allienating you. :-)
>
> Good Luck! I hope you find what you are looking for. :-)
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Ken Lee <kenlee@...>
> To: <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
> Sent: Thursday, April 22, 1999 12:24 PM
> Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: Digest Number 18
>
>
> > From: "Ken Lee" <kenlee@...>
> >
> > Whoa. Hold on there, Iggie didn't say YOU, he said that there are a
> lot
> > of +pvp players that are jerks. There are also a ton of -pvp players that
> > are jerks as well. I'll tell you about Elyas the loser Paladin on Solusek
> Ro
> > sometime. Enabling +pvp or -pvp is a choice you make, and because Verant
> has
> > decided to offer you this choice, it is also up to them to protect players
> > that don't share a +pvp view. They've given you 'free zones' where
> even -pvp
> > players are fair game, they've given you an entire +pvp server. I don't
> see
> > what more they can offer? Are thee bugs, yes that's true, but I think that
> > fixing global bugs that affect everyone will be more of a priority than
> bugs
> > that affect a single class. So you have restrictions that I do not have as
> > a -pvp wizard. It was your choice, so live with it. Learn to get around
> it,
> > and I'm sure that you'll have a much better experience for it.
> >
> > You also have to remember that it's THEIR world you're in, so you
> have
> > to conform to them, they don't have to conform to you, even though a lot
> of
> > player suggestions have been implemented. I'm still waiting for a patch
> that
> > will save the choice of how I view servers. Why would anyone want to view
> by
> > number of players once you've created and levelled your characters is a
> > mystery to me. : )
> >
> > Try and remember that there's nothing that they've done is to be
> > intentionally harmful to the -pvp class, but given a choice the majority
> has
> > to rule, and that majority is -pvp. Their priorities concerning +pvp will
> > always come first. However, non combat spells you should be able to cast
> on
> > others. Bind Affinity, O'Keils radiation, Invisibility, great spells, and
> > I'm behind you 110% in that you should be able to use them on others. I'm
> > sure they'll change it in the future, but how long depends on how hard it
> is
> > to code.
> >
> > Zalbar
> > 14th Wizard
> > Solusek Ro
> >
> >

> Verant
